title: Chichester City handed bye into second round of FA Cup and donate part of £36,000 prize to Bury FC
text:
Chichester City have been handed a dream draw after making it to the first round of the FA Cup for the first time.

The Isthmian League Division One South East club, the lowest ranked left in the competition, landed a bye to the second round as a result of Bury's expulsion from the competition.

Theirs was the last ball to be selected in the draw, which was conducted by former England international Karen Carney and ex-Leeds and Everton striker Jermaine Beckford.

Chichester City landed a bye to the second round as a result of Bury's expulsion from FA Cup

FA Cup magic! The moment non-league @ChiCityFC found out they'd got a bye into the #FACup 2nd round, earning £36,000 without having to kick a ball! pic.twitter.com/vhGHkmip2E — BBC South (@BBCSouthNews) October 21, 2019

After the draw Chichester announced they would 'make a donation to the appropriate organisation involved with the continuation of Bury'.

The Sussex side entered this season's FA Cup at the extra preliminary round stage. They have won six ties and collected more than £82,000 in prize money.

Isthmian League Premier side Potters Bar will secure a home tie against League One Fleetwood, managed by Joey Barton, if they can get past National League Barnet in a replay, while Isthmian League North outfit Maldon and Tiptree travel to League Two Leyton Orient.

National League Harrogate will welcome 2008 winners Portsmouth, while League Two Carlisle head for Dulwich Hamlet, who play their football in National League South.

Twice winners Sunderland have been handed an all-League One affair with Gillingham, while third-tier rivals Ipswich and Lincoln and AFC Wimbledon and Doncaster will also battle it out for a place in the second round.

The winners of the replay between Hayes & Yeading and Poole will entertain League One Oxford, while Morecambe face a short trip to Blackpool for a Fylde coast derby.

Haringey, whose fourth qualifying round clash with Yeovil was abandoned after both teams walked off as a result of alleged racial abuse, will host National League Hartlepool if they win next week's rescheduled tie.

A man was arrested on suspicion of a racially-aggravated public order offence during the north-east club's league clash with Dover at Victoria Park last month.
description: The Isthmian League Division One South East club, the lowest ranked left in the competition, landed a bye to the second round as a result of Bury's expulsion from the competition.
